body: @kehra The issue is actually comes from `count`, not from `reload`. I‚Äôm not very familiar with the [UnmodifiableRelation](https://edgeapi.rubyonrails.org/classes/ActiveRecord/UnmodifiableRelation.html) error, but based on the documentation, you can‚Äôt modify a loaded relation. Calling `count` on a loaded relation will re-query the database, which triggers the error. To solve this in your case, you can use .size instead of .count.

@Jay0921 
Thanks for replying.

However, if the argument for `.group` is changed to `:id`, no error occurs, so I think it is not an issue with `.count`.
For example, making the following change does not cause an error.

```diff
--- test.rb     2024-12-13 23:18:47.301787586 +0900
+++ test2.rb    2024-12-13 23:18:31.166493789 +0900
@@ -47,13 +47,15 @@
     post = Post.create!
     post.comments.create!

-    posts = Post.joins(:comments).group('comments.id')
+    posts = Post.joins(:comments).group(:id)

     assert_equal({1 => 1}, posts.count)

     post.comments.create!

     posts.reload
-    assert_equal({1 => 1, 2 => 1}, posts.count)
+    assert_equal({1 => 2}, posts.count)
   end
 end
```

My explanation was slightly incorrect.
I don't think it's **solely** an issue with `.count`.

However, I'm not sure if this behavior is intentional or not.
This looks similar to #53260, which was fixed by #53264, and also similar to #53983 (though that doesn't seem to fix this specific issue), both of which seem to stem from #53064.

I don't think #53983 actually fixed this as the original steps to reproduce still fail against main after the merge, though it definitely seems highly similar. I think the grouping here triggers a slightly different code path that likely needs it's own fix. I'll see if I can work up a PR to fix this.

issue.title: Fix count with group by qualified name on loaded relation
issue.body:
Run `arel_columns` on the spawned relation because `arel_columns` is no longer a side-effect free helper method since #53064.

Fixes #53934.

body: Thanks for the report, this issue on "group by" will be fixed by #53994.

> Thanks for the report, this issue on "group by" will be fixed by [#53994](https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/53994).

üëÜüèªThank you for that @kamipo ! 

This was merged on December 18th and latest release of Rails 7.2.2.1 was wrapped up on 10th so this is bug is actually still on latest Rails 7 version. 

Can we imagine to add it as well on a version 7.2.2.2?
That was backported at 789d6cf1a923a99ea0add3dd0814a22b7cc7860a to 7-2-stable branch, so it will be included in the 7.2.3 release.
